children.text: Jayant should bowl slightly short. All the turn is on the good length spot, just short of the driving length. Bowl the length where the batsman has to lunge forward, but cant drive it.

@MUHTASIM-US Man I don't wish to watch negative stuff.I would rather watch Perth 2008 a million more times.It is for the players to take care of the cricketing stuff.Constructive criticism is fine,but going overboard to undermine someone isn't acceptable.If Sydney 2008 is the only reason for the Indian fans wanting to bash the Aussies,I find it bemusing.Nobody is going to take offense if one says Smith will have to improve the consistency of performances away from home.He has played a few good knocks away from home too.You can't simply pull down a player who averages 60 after 51 tests.Same with the Aussie fans too calling Ashwin only good at home.This is something that does not reflect well.As far as I can see,all the 22 playing there are worth their places and can steal the show at any point of time.I only wish there is more respect accorded to the players from fans of both sides.

So a rank turner right from day one and ball zipping jumping from 20th over . This to beat australia ? The days of the seventies when we used to present dusty bowls with the invincible spin quartet in our armoury Has made a comeback yet again . Its clear that this one not gonna last 4 days even ! At least tracks like we had against england would have been better
There are no comments for this item
India V Australia, 1st Test, Pune, 1st Day
